Package pieces

Class King

java.lang.Object
pieces.Piece
pieces.King
public class King
extends Piece
Chess piece that can move to and capture the 8 cells adjacent to it. When the king is inescapably threatened, its player loses.

    • King

      public King​(int x, int y, boolean isWhite)
      Constructs a king and places it at a specified position on the board.
      Parameters:
      x - the column to place the king
      y - the row to place the king
      isWhite - - whether the piece is white

  • Method Details

    • isValidMove

      public boolean isValidMove​(int x, int y)
      Checks if the piece can move in the specified way, not accounting for check or player turn. Does not account for castling.
      Specified by:
      isValidMove in class Piece
      Parameters:
      x - the column to move to
      y - the row to move to
      Returns:
      true if the move is valid, and false otherwise

    • isInCheck

      public boolean isInCheck()
      Checks if the king is in check.
      Returns:
      true if the king is in check, and false otherwise

    • isInCheckmate

      public boolean isInCheckmate()
      Checks for checkmate.
      Returns:
      true if king is in checkmate, and false otherwise

    • everyPieceValidMoves

      private java.util.Map<Piece,​java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>>> everyPieceValidMoves​(boolean onlyWhitePieces, boolean accountForCheck)
      Finds all valid moves of all pieces belonging to a player.
      Returns:
      a map connecting each piece to a list of all its valid moves
